page.title: 07Farming
page.content: All the farmers receive government hillfarm subsidy. They concentrate on rearing cattle and sheep, and growing cereals, roots and grass for animal feed. Stowe Farm, 560 acres, is rented from the Stanage Estate and worked by a family plus hired labour. They keep 1200 sheep (Kerry and cross breed) 130 calves and grow 80 acres of barley. The rest is pasture, rough grazing and woodland. Stud Farm, 205 acres, is owned freehold and run by a father and two sons. They keep 323 ewes, 10 rams, 43 Friesian/Hereford cross cattle for fattening plus one for milk and 10 hens for eggs. They grow 30 acres barley, 5 oats, 10 swedes, 110 acres pasture and 50 acres scrub and oak woodland. Upper Lurkenhope and Garn Bank Farms follow a similar farming pattern and all sell stock in Knighton Market.
